title: Multiply by $$1$$
text: The first step is to multiply the measurement to be converted by 1; write $$1$$ as a fraction relating the units given and the units needed.
speech: The first step is to multiply the measurement to be converted by 1: write  1  as a fraction relating the units given and the units needed.
pacedSpeech: The first step is to multiply the measurement to be converted by 1 write   1
as a fraction relating the units given and the units needed.

title: Relating $$m$$ to km
text: The conversion from meters to kilometers is 1,000 $$m=1$$ km.
speech: The conversion from meters to kilometers is 1,000  m is equal to 1,  km.
pacedSpeech: The conversion from meters to kilometers is 1,000   m is equal to 1,

title: Writing $$1$$ as a Fraction
text: Using the relation between km and $$m$$, we can rewrite the $$1$$ we multiply in the first step as (1 km)/(1000 m), so we get the expression (3072 m)*(1 km)/(1000 m).
speech: Using the relation between km and  m , we can rewrite the  1,  we multiply in the first step as (1 km)/(1000 m), so we get the expression (3072 m)*(1 km)/(1000 m).
pacedSpeech: Using the relation between km and   m
we multiply in the first step as (1 km)/(1000 m), so we get the expression (3072 m)*(1 km)/(1000 m).

title: Simplifying
text: $$m$$ divides out, so we get the expression (3072)*(1 km)/1000.
speech: m  divides out, so we get the expression (3072)*(1 km)/1000.
pacedSpeech: divides out, so we get the expression (3072)*(1 km)/1000.

title: Dividing
text: Dividing the expression, we get the final answer $$3.072$$ km.
speech: Dividing the expression, we get the final answer  3.072  km.
pacedSpeech: Dividing the expression, we get the final answer   3.072
